title: Direction of electric field between charged plates

content.prompt: Which of the following indicates the direction of the electric field at point P and the reason it has that direction?

choices.label: The electric field is in the +x direction because the charges are equal and opposite.
The electric field is in the -y direction because point P is farther from the positively charged plate.
The electric field is in the -y direction because electric fields point away from positive charge and toward negative charge.
The electric field is in the +y direction because electric fields point away from negative charge and toward positive charge.

skill.text: 3.C: Justify or support a claim using evidence from experimental data, physical representations, or physical principles or laws.
